snippet: More than two dozen so-called Stand Your Ground statutes enacted in recent years are drawing greater scrutiny in light of the Trayvon Martin case.
abstract: More than two dozen so-called Stand Your Ground statutes across the country are coming under increased scrutiny following the shooting death of Trayvon Martin; laws have proliferated following intense campaign by the National Rifle Association to expand self-defense statutes as well as laws that legalize the carrying of concealed weapons.
lead_paragraph: More than two dozen so-called Stand Your Ground statutes enacted in recent years are drawing greater scrutiny in light of the Trayvon Martin case.

headline.seo: N.R.A. Campaign Leads to Expanded Self-Defense Laws
headline.main: N.R.A.’s Influence Seen in Expansion of Self-Defense Laws
headline.print_headline: N.R.A. Push Has Advanced Broader Laws On Self-Defense
